title: Business Live: FTSE 100 closes higher - BBC News
summary: tesco facing largest ever equal pay claim .
uk house prices fall for two months in a row .

documents.title: negative brexit forecasts revealed
text: negative brexit forecasts revealed

documents.title: good night
text: thanks for tuning in to business live .
we 'll be back at 6am tomorrow .

documents.title: new rail complaints app launched
text: app lets commuters share gripes with rail operators
even though i never use trains i can see the network being g overloaded by the quantity of complaints .
i thought that is what twitter is for ?
do n't we have facebook or twitter for this ?

documents.title: tesla 's losses widen
text: tesla 's losses widenend in the three months to the end of december .
the electric car maker lost $ 675.4m ( £ 487m ) up from $ 121.3m - making it its biggest ever quarterly loss .
meanwhile revenue rose to $ 3.29bn - up from $ 2.28bn .

documents.title: 21st century fox profits more than double
text: profits at 21st century fox more than doubled to $ 1.83bn ( £ 1.3bn ) in the second quarter ending 31 december- boosted by a $ 1.34bn gain from the recent shake up of the us tax law .
revenue increased by 4.6 % to $ 8.04bn .

documents.title: wall street shares end day lower
text: on wall street all three key stock indexes were down at the close of play on wednesday .
the dow jones closed down 19 points or 0.78 % at 24,893.35 .
the tech-heavy nasdaq also fell , ending the day at 7,051.98 , a fall of 64 points or 0.9 % .
and the s & p 500 edged down to 2,681.62 , a fall of 14 points or 0.5 %

documents.title: firm prosecuted over auto-enrolment pension violations
text: the pensions regulator has successfully concluded its first criminal prosecution of an employer for failing to comply with the auto-enrolment regulations .
bus company stotts tours were fined £ 27,000 at brighton magistrates court , while boss alan stott has been ordered to pay a fine of £ 4,455 .
the total costs , including previous fines for non-compliance and the backdated pension contributions , amount to over £ 60,000 .
a bus company and it 's boss have become the first in the country to be sentenced for failing to automatically enroll staff in a workplace pension .
stotts tours and alan stott will have to pay £ 60,000 .
@ twitterid have warned companies not to bury their heads in the sand # pensions
ì know one other place that got no company pension or any heath and safety where i work
i 'm sure @ twitterid will follow this up .
please dm me with your details .

documents.title: brazil approves bayer-monsanto deal
text: brazil 's competition regulator has approved bayer 's proposed takeover of us seeds giant monsanto , as long as certain conditions are met .
the cade agency said it would permit the tie-up if bayer agreed to an eu proposal to offload certain assets to chemicals giant basf .
the merger , valued at $ 66bn when announced in september 2016 , would create the world 's largest seeds and pesticides company .
however , the firms still need approval from jurisdictions including the eu and us where final rulings are still pending .

documents.title: weight watchers targets teen market
text: weight watchers has said it will offer free memberships to teens ages 13 through 17 this summer , as part of a bigger drive to expand its reach .
the weight loss company said the offer would help it be `` a powerful partner for families in establishing healthy habits '' .
it is also eliminating artificial ingredients from its products .
the measures are part of a plan to attract more members and bring in more than $ 2bn in annual revenue by 2020 - news of which lifted shares 18 % on wednesday .
weight watchers , founded in 1963 , has been in turnaround mode in recent years as it aims to reduce debt and reach new members .
in 2015 , oprah winfrey took a stake in the firm and agreed to promote its programme .
weight watchers also recently signed hip hop star dj khaled as an `` ambassador '' for the company .
weight watchers took in roughly $ 1bn in the first nine months of 2017 .
the company had about 1.3 million meeting members and 2 million online subscribers at the end of september .
author: Natalie Sherman
New York business reporter

documents.title: rabobank pleads guilty to processing illicit funds
text: dutch lender rabobank has agreed to pay more than $ 360m and pleaded guilty in the us to processing illicit funds , as well as conspiring to obstruct an examination by a regulator .
according to the us department of justice , the bank admitted it allowed hundreds of millions of dollars in untraceable cash from mexico and elsewhere to be deposited into branches in california .

rabobank chose to look the other way '' when it learned of transactions indicative of international drug trafficking , organised crime and money laundering , acting assistant us attorney general john cronan said in a statement .

bank executives then tried to hide its anti-money laundering program deficiencies during a 2012 examination by the regulator , the us office of the comptroller of the currency ( occ ) , the statement said .

documents.title: no brexit deal 'would hit ni economy by 12 % '
text: no brexit deal 'would hit ni economy by 12 % '
author: John Campbell
BBC News NI Economics & Business Editor

documents.title: snap shares leap on rising user numbers
text: shares in snap - the parent of messaging app snapchat - are up almost 50 % after the firm posted its first user growth since going public in 2017 .
the firm added 8.9 million users in the three months to the end of 2017 .
revenue was up as well , reaching $ 287.5m ( £ 207m ) - a 72 % year-on-year increase .
it follows a redesign of the app intended to help snapchat compete with instagram and facebook .

documents.title: mixed for us stocks
text: after climbing earlier on , wall street markets have lost a little steam .
the dow jones is up half a per cent at 25,047.17 points , while the s & p 500 is flat at 2,697.42 .
the nasdaq is down 0.2 % at 7,102.66 points .

documents.title: contingency plans 'in place ' in event of another carillion
text: a short while a go , mps on the liason committee asked whether there were contingency plans in place in the event another big contractor such as carillion can not fulfill vital government contracts .

john manzoni , chief executive of the civil service and permanent secretary , would only be drawn as far as to say various government departments were responsible for drawing up such plans and currently there were between 10 and 100 in place .
he said civil servants were having a normal dialogue '' with firms so they could be alert to potential risks .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: harley davidson issues recall
text: motorcycle maker harley-davidson is recalling nearly 175,000 bikes in the us over fears the brakes could fail .

the national highway traffic safety administration ( nhtsa ) said that if brake fluid on the motorcycles was not replaced for a `` prolonged period '' beyond the recommended two-year schedule , deposits could form on internal components .
this could reduce braking ability and increase the risk of a crash .
the regulator began investigating the problem in 2016 after receiving complaints about sudden brake loss , and said the recall covers 31 models from 2008-2011 .

documents.title: eu migration chief hits out at 'sick minds ' over greece bribery probe
text: the eu 's migration chief has denounced a major corruption investigation in greece as an `` unprecedented plot '' .
dimitris avramopoulos is among 10 greek politicians named by prosecutors in a probe involving the swiss pharmaceutical company novartis .
novartis is accused of paying top politicians bribes in exchange for price-fixing their medicines .
prosecutors believe this could have cost the state billions during a painful financial crisis .
read more

documents.title: dft also assessed carillion - lidington
text: mr liddington said the department for transport also assessed carillion after its profit warning .
`` they called in the other consortium members [ for the hs2 contract ] and said in the light of [ the profit warning ] are you still happy to do a joint-venture with them ?
they signed up to the joint and several liability contracts . ''
he added that when carillion did go bust the partners did n't hesitate to step in and fulfil their commitments .
in this situation it has worked , '' he said
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: carillion 'passed ' viability tests after profit warning - lidington
text: the rt hon david lidington cbe mp , minister for the cabinet office , has been asked about how the government reacted to the profit warning from carillion last july .
shortly after the warning , the government awarded the construction giant a joint-venture contract to build hs2 .
mr lidington said the government stepped up meetings with carillion following the warning .
they also re-ran the financial checks necessary to ensure a supplier has the wherewithal to manage a contract .
`` carillion and the joint-venture they were part of still passed the tests , '' he said .

documents.title: dozens charged for infraud cyber-crime sitehsbc and paypal were among firms targeted
text: dozens charged for infraud cyber-crime site

documents.title: government 'could do more ' to assess suppliers - morse
text: the government spent about £ 250bn on outsourced contracts in 2016 , bernard jenkin mp says .
but how sure is it that those suppliers are financially viable ?
sir amyas morse tells mps that under current rules , the government must ensure firms bidding for state contracts are credible .
but he says they could do more .
`` we need to have a frank discussion about what the risk is , '' he says , pointing out that banks and business shoulder a lot of the risk too .
`` in [ the case of carillion ] it 's likely the government 's intervention might cost around £ 300m - it 's not a monstrous number but it 's a serious number , '' he says .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: brexit impact assessments show north east hit hardest
text: here 's the full table from the government 's brexit economic forecast showing projected lost growth , with the north east predicted to be the worst-hit part of the uk .
outside the single market the region will be hit twice as hard as the uk as a whole , and around five times as hard as london .
author: Richard Moss
Political Editor, BBC Look North

documents.title: treasury committee sets deadline for fca to publish rbs report
text: the treasury committee has set a deadline for the financial conduct authority ( fca ) to publish its controversial report on rbs 's global restructuring group .
grg has been accused of mistreating small business customers before and after the financial crisis .
the fca carried out a report on the matter but has only published a summary of it .
but yesterday , labour mp clive lewis said he had read the report in full and that the watchdog was withholding important information from the public .
nicky morgan mp , chair of the treasury committee , has now called on andrew bailey , chief executive of the fca , to publish the report or send a copy to the committee by 16 february 2018 .
mrs morgan said :
a version of the report is in the hands of third parties , it has been selectively reported by the media , and it may enter the public domain at any time .
the fca has lost control over the timing or content of further public disclosures from it .
for these reasons , the committee has requested that the fca publish the final definitive version of the report , or send it to the committee , by friday 16 february . ''

documents.title: brexit impact report figures leaked to bbc
text: mps have been allowed to see the brexit impact report leaked to buzzfeed last month .
they were allowed to read them on a confidential basis , but the figures were quickly leaked to the bbc .
political editor laura kuenssberg has shared figures showing the expected hit to economic growth in various regions , based on three possible post brexit trade arrangements .
here is the full regional breakdown of the economic impact assessments that mps have now been able to see
important to note forecasts are for a fifteen year period - and predict how much more slowly the economy would grow , not how much it would shrink

documents.title: accounting practices in construction 'fuzzy '
text: accounting practices in the construction industry should also be reviewed , sir amyas morse tells mps .
they are often `` fuzzy '' and there 's a tendency to `` rob the later contracts to make performance look better '' , he says .
accountancy firm kpmg will be investigated by the financial reporting council over its handling of carillion 's accounts .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: construction firms addicted to government contracts - morse
text: sir amyas morse says the construction sector needs to think quite deeply '' about the margins it makes and the risks it takes in the wake of carillion .
insolvencies are all too common in the industry , he tells nicky morgan mp (
procurement rules that stop the government intervening in the publicly outsourced services market should also be reviewed , he says .
you tend to get over-concentration and business models based on continued rapid growth .
but what 's happened is government has stopped injecting more and more contracts into the system .
for a number of years , many of these companies were addicted to achieving growth by winning more and more government contracts . ''
better financial viability tests of such companies are needed , he says .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: mps grill regulators on response to carillion collapse
text: the liason committee of mps is hearing evidence from regulators about their response to the carillion collapse .
the first witness is sir amyas morse , comptroller and auditor general , at spending watchdog the national audit office .
some have questioned whether regulators did enough to prevent the construction firm 's failure .

documents.title: stocks rebound 'as calm returns '
text: equities are in recovery mode today after enduring a turbulent week , david madden of cmc markets uk says :
a combination of shorting covering and bargain hunting is helping [ european ] markets today .
it has been a brutal week for investors , but some are keen to step in and take advantage of the fall in prices .
there is still a sense we could be in for another leg lower , and for that reason some dealers are reluctant to get back into the market . ''
the dow jones and s & p 500 are higher on the day as us stocks continue their bounce back .
the volatility index ( vix ) , or the fear index as it is referred to by traders has slumped , and investors are cautiously optimistic about the us equity market .
the crash at the beginning of the week is starting to entice some buyers , but normal business has not resumed as some dealers are still nervous . ''

documents.title: ftse 100 closes higher
text: the ftse 100 has closed up , having rebounded from tuesday 's fall .
at the bell it was 1.94 % , or 138.21 points , higher at 7,279.61 .

documents.title: weight watchers rallies on growth plan
text: there 's money to be made in helping people lose weight - at least weight watchers seems to think so .
the us company 's shares have jumped 15 % after it raised its revenue target to more than $ 2bn by 2020 .
that 's 50 % higher than analyst expectations for the 2017 financial year .
the firm , which boasts star oprah winfrey as an ambassador , said it plans to boost sales through new members and higher retention .

documents.title: stock markets ' wild ride
text: the ftse 100 may be rebounding from tuesday 's fall - it 's up 2.2 % - but it 's been on a wild ride this week , losing all of its gains for 2018 .
the same goes for the dow jones , as these bbc data charts show :

documents.title: key week for toys r us ?
text: mark kleinman is the city editor of sky news .
he tweets :
exclusive : toys r us seeks bids for ailing uk operations before the end of the week as fears mount for 3200 jobs .
european operations in ten other countries including germany and spain also on the block .
interested to read a & m 's nominees report again .
lots of cvas fail , but within 6 weeks ?

documents.title: where we are with brexit - in 300 words
text: where we are with brexit - in 300 words
author: Brian Wheeler
Political reporter

documents.title: nissan to meet pm amid brexit concerns
text: carmaker nissan said it and other japanese companies would meet prime minister theresa may and chancellor philip hammond on thursday to discuss their business in the uk .
japanese firms have spent billions of dollars in britain over recent decades , using it as a business-friendly base from which to trade across europe .
but there are fears their exports could face tariffs of up to 10 % and be subject to lengthy customs delays after brexit .

`` nissan europe chairman paul willcox will join representatives from other japanese companies in meeting the prime minister and chancellor on thursday to discuss our operations and investments in the uk , '' nissan said in a statement .
`` we will not be disclosing details of the discussions . ''

documents.title: star wars toy sales lose the force
text: hasbro sales have fallen due in part to weaker demand for star wars toys .
the us toy firm 's revenue fell 2.1 % in the fourth quarter to $ 1.6bn , lower than analysts expected .
hasbro 's partner brands segment , which include star wars , frozen and marvel merchandise , slumped by 21 % in the fourth quarter .
the firm blamed bad timing as consumers were bombarded by products based on the last jedi , thor and justice league films .
in 2015 , the firm enjoyed huge sales of star wars toys ahead of `` the force awakens , '' the first `` star wars '' film in nearly a decade .

documents.title: trump comments on market volatility
text: the us president broken his silence about the sharp falls on us markets in recent days .

in a tweet he noted that the plunge on wall street - which rippled across the globe - started from relatively good news about increasing us wages , which added to fears that interest rates would rise sooner than expected .
the president has previously claimed that the large gains on us stock markets since his election were a sign his economic policies were working .
in the old days , '' when good news was reported , the stock market would go up .
today , when good news is reported , the stock market goes down .

documents.title: fca told to move faster on rbs report
text: the chief executive of the financial conduct authority andrew bailey is appearing before a panel of mps .

he is being asked about an fca report which examined the conduct of royal bank of scotland and its global restructuring group ( grg ) , which dealt with more than 12,000 companies between 2007 and 2012 .
the report , which has not been made public in full , found that almost all of the viable companies transferred to grg received `` innapropriate treatement '' .
the bbc 's andrew verity is watching the hearing .
@ twitterid has confirmed a full copy of the s.166 report has been handed to her office .
says she 'll write with clear request for timetable to publish - `` otherwise the fca might find that events overtake them ''
@ twitterid to andrew bailey : `` we know of cases where people have committed suicide i think transparency is now such the report is out there .
i do n't think there is time now for you to go through the whole maxwellisation process we have talked of in the past . ''
maxwellisation is a convention , not an obligation .

@ twitterid knew the report was for publication , so in the very unlikely event of successful litigation by those named , i would expect @ twitterid could pass on any awards to pfg time 's up : ca n't protect the perps any longer !

documents.title: profits jump at gsk
text: net profits jumped 70 % last year at glaxosmithkline thanks to bumper sales at the british drugs giant .
profits after tax climbed to around £ 1.5bn while revenue rose 8 % to £ 30.2bn .
the firm saw higher sales in each of its three main businesses , pharmaceuticals , vaccines and consumer healthcare .
it was also buoyed also by the weaker pound , which made its exports cheaper - although it sustained a fourth-quarter loss in part because of us tax reforms .

documents.title: us stocks turn positive
text: after opening lower wall street markets are heading upwards , with the dow jones now up almost half a per cent .
the nasdaq and s & p 500 are also in positive territory .

documents.title: us stocks open lower
text: the main us share indexes have opened lower on wednesday .
the dow jones industrial average fell 108.2 points , or 0.43 % , to 24,804.57 points after gaining almost 2 % yesterday .
the s & p 500 lost 8.22 points , or 0.3 % to 2,686.92 , while the nasdaq dropped 22.22 points , or 0.31 % , to 7,093.66 .

documents.title: carlsberg profits hit by russia alcohol campaign
text: profits at carlsberg have dived more than 70 % after a crackdown on alcohol abuse in russia hit beer sales .
the tuborg and somersby cider-maker saw annual net profits fall to 1.3 billion danish krone ( £ 155 million ) last year , down from 4.5 billion krone as russian beer sales fell 14 % .
russia is a key market for carlsberg , but a nationwide cap on plastic beer bottles at 1.5 litres has taken its toll on performance .
the copenhagen-based firm was also hit by 4.8 billion krone charge linked to its russian baltika brand .
group revenues in 2017 slipped 1 % to 61.8 billion krone , the firm said .

documents.title: rachel reeves condemns taylor review responseurgent question : taylor review
text: labour chair of the business committee , rachel reeves , complains that the government is now saying it will consult the experts when that was what the taylor review was about .
she says the plans announced do `` very little to help the bogusly self-employed '' and asks the government to `` be a little bit more ambitious '' .
the minister does n't accept this , saying the measures `` will help millions of workers '' .
he adds it is `` hugely complicated and we do need to consult further '' , not on whether to take taylor 's recommendations forward but how to do so .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: government plans for gig economy workers 'window-dressing'urgent question : taylor review
text: shadow business secretary rebecca long-bailey says many workers face `` precarious and unstable '' conditions in the gig economy , and have not been helped by the `` failure of the government to protect workers '' adding it is `` papering over the realities '' .
she claims the government 's proposals do n't specify which rights apply to which workers from day one , do nothing to abolish undercutting and include not one mention of trade unions .
she calls it `` window-dressing '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: working practices proposals under scrutinyurgent question : taylor review
text: shadow business secretary rebecca long-bailey is asking an urgent question on the taylor review into working practices .
the government has promised an overhaul of employment rights to improve conditions for millions of workers , including those in the gig economy .
the changes include stricter enforcement of holiday and sick pay rights , and higher fines for firms that breach contracts or mistreat staff .
it is a response to last year 's taylor review into working practices .
business minister andrew griffiths tells mps the government is taking on `` 52 of the 53 recommendations '' in the taylor review .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: los angeles times to be sold in $ 500m deal
text: tronc is to sell the los angeles times and the san diego tribune newspapers in a $ 500m deal , reuters reports .
billionaire biotech investor patrick soon-shiong will buy the titles , among others , assuming $ 90m of pension liabilities .
like other media firms , chicago-based tronc has been struggling with the newspaper industry 's shift to digital and has been forced to cut jobs .

commenting on the deal , tronc boss justin dearborn said : `` this transaction allows us to fully repay our outstanding debt , significantly lower our pension liabilities and have a substantial cash position following the close of the transaction . ''

documents.title: wall street expected to open lower
text: it 's still all calm in london and european trading with the ftse 100 currently up about 1 % .
however , wall street is expected to rock the boat .
current predictions - based on volatile pre-market futures trading - suggest all three of wall street 's main indexes are on course for falls of between 0.2 and 0.3 % .

documents.title: hasbro reports disappointing christmas performance
text: us toymaker hasbro has reported disappointing revenue figures from the christmas trading period .
hasbro reported a net loss of $ 5.3m for the three months until 31 december 2017 , compared with a profit of $ 192.7m during the same period in the previous year .

the toymaker said the decline was due to a drop in sales of popular `` partner brand '' toys that had been expected to do well over the holiday season - namely star wars toys and products from disney 's frozen .
european revenues were also in decline , and the bankruptcy of toys r ' us also affected its sales .

documents.title: glaxosmithkline cautious about 2018 outlook
text: drugmaker glaxosmithkline ( gsk ) has reported full-year revenues of £ 30.2bn for 2017 , up 8 % on the previous year and ahead of analyst expectations .
however , the firm was cautious in its forecast for 2018 .
should competitors create generic copies of its flagship asthma medication advair , then earnings will likely be flat , or down 3 % at worst .
despite the uncertainty , gsk is `` increasingly confident '' it will be able to deliver mid to high single digit earnings growth over the 2016 to 2020 period .

documents.title: jim carrey 'unfriending facebook '
text: actor jim carrey has announced on twitter that he has decided to sell his shares in facebook because he disagrees with how the social network allowed political ads to be run on its platform during the us presidential elections .

sorry , it was a blog post i did around why i was leaving facebook and the damaging effects of social media - the link is buried in it .
here it is :

documents.title: crypto-currency regulation not key priority for ecb
text: the european central bank has told cnbc that regulating crypto-currencies is not one of its top priorities .

`` we scrutinise the issue in a regulatory perspective , we are ready to do something if it was needed , but so far it 's not exactly very high on our to-do list , '' said the central bank 's chief supervisor daniele nouy .

although the ecb will continue to keep an eye on digital currencies and possible risks , such as bitcoin futures contracts on us stock exchanges , ms nouy said the ecb is not particularly worried , since so far there is n't interest from european lenders .

documents.title: niesr ups uk growth outlook
text: britain 's brexit-bound economy will grow faster than previously thought over the next two years , thanks mostly to strength in the global economy , the national institute of economic and social research said .
uk gross domestic product will grow by 1.9 % in 2018 and in 2019 , the think tank said , up from its november forecasts of 1.7 % for both years .
by comparison , the world economy is now set to expand by 3.9 % and 3.8 % in 2018 and 2019 respectively , up from niesr 's november forecasts of 3.6 % and 3.5 % .

documents.title: should we holiday destinations on ethics ?
text: in many the islands that make up the maldives are so beautiful that they almost look unreal .
this week brought trouble in paradise , however.the president refused to honour a supreme court order to release jailed opposition leaders , and declared a state of emergency .
the move was condemned internationally , and some observers said tourists should boycott the country on human rights grounds .
their argument begs the question : should we all our holiday destinations for their ethical credentials ?

documents.title: 'key issues remain ' in boeing and embraer talks
text: aerospace giant boeing says there are still key issues at stake that must be ironed out before a partnership will be possible with brazilian aviation firm embraer .
`` our talks continue to advance in a productive manner but there are key issues that remain , '' phil musser , boeing 's senior vice president of communications said at the singapore airshow .
`` as noted on our earnings call this is a winning combination but it is not a 'must do ' for boeing .
`` the final terms - and price - need to provide the best value for our respective customers investors and countries to provide an optimal platform for success . ''

documents.title: gig economy employers need to start planning
text: although the trade union congress is disappointed with the government 's gig economy proposals for workers ' rights , lawyers warn that this problem wo n't be going away , and employers should start planning ahead .

for now , 'employers ' of gig economy workers should be making contingencies against holiday and sick pay rights and rethinking their business model , as plans to increase the cost of labour for this group of individuals are afoot , '' said nick hurley , partner at law firm charles russell speechlys .
`` what is certain is that 1.8 million individuals will be expecting some improvements imminently as the light has been switched on , albeit a dim one , at the end of the tunnel . ''

documents.title: do n't panic
text: us entrepreneur elon musk has launched his new rocket , the falcon heavy , from the kennedy space center in florida .
the mammoth vehicle - the most powerful since the shuttle system - lifted clear of its pad without incident to soar high over the atlantic ocean .
the payload was a cherry-red tesla sportscar put into orbit around the sun - and it has a live-feed .
in a nod to douglas adams ' `` hitchhikers guide to the galaxy '' the gps screen reads `` do n't panic '' , and the car radio is set to play a loop of a david bowie soundtrack .

documents.title: softer-line german finance minister ?
text: there 's speculation the spd mayor of hamburg olaf scholz will become germany 's new finance minister .
if so , this could be good news for the uk in brexit talks with the eu .
unlike former finance minister wolfgang schauble , who adopted a tough approach towards the uk , mayor scholz has spoken positively about the future between the eu and uk .

he told his local newspaper after the referendum result about the importance of a close and important partnership with britain '' and how the uk is `` leaving the eu , but remains part of the european family .
we have to make new ties when old ones tear . ''
author: Rob Young
Business presenter

documents.title: german parties 'reach coalition deal in principle '
text: german chancellor angela merkel 's conservatives and the social democrats have agreed on a coalition deal in principle , reuters reports .
germany has been unable to cobble a government together for four months , concerning investors and partner countries .

documents.title: uk house prices fell in january
text: halifax says that british house prices unexpectedly fell in january by 0.6 % , lowering the annual rate of price growth in the three months to january to 2.2 % from 2.7 % in december .
this was the lowest year-on-year growth rate since july , when prices rose as their slowest rate in more than four years .

although employment levels grew by 102,000 in the three months to november , household finances are still under pressure as consumer prices continue to grow faster than wages , '' said russell galley , a managing director at halifax .

documents.title: 'we need to show them what it looks like '
text: bbc 's political editor laura kuenssberg tweets about the uk government 's efforts to secure a good brexit deal

wo n't be detailed agreement this week , but whitehall source says - 'agreement at these meetings is critical to empower the pm to take forward negotiations - if we want to avoid the eu closing the door on a bespoke , bold and ambitious deal , we need to show them what it looks like '
simple- staying in the customs union will stop us trading on good terms with the rest of the world so = no .
it 's no too to a transition deal that will impose unfair terms on the u.k. & allow the eu to punish us .
having sorted out those & allowing the ni border to stay open = done

in addition to other replies- we have absolutely no guarantee , and actually many risks that the deals we get with row after brexit will be less good than the ones we got as members of the eu & customs union .
we have far less to offer , and far less leverage , than eu .
oh ye of little faith- how did we ever get along before ?
we got along by being the largest empire and trading block in a far less interconnected world .
that 's how .
it 's not the 19th century anymore , and even then us is now far more constrained than we were then
no one said it would be easy- that 's the trouble too many people are willing to give up their freedom and live in blissful ignorance .
give me the red pill every time
actually lots of the leave promotion was that it would be extremely easy ( cf .
boris johnson , david davis , dan hannan , etc . )
unfortunately it turns out that not only is brexit not easy , it 's also worse and actually means giving up freedoms and rights that we have .
incidentally , you are welcome to your red pill .
anyone who talks about `` red pill '' ing seems to be a bit of fruit loop in my experience .

here we go with the insults- you fbpe people ca n't help yourselves and can not do rational debate or accept another view at least i have a world view unlike you who is quite happy to live in a bubble- please go away
# r4today the fact that with a year to go @ twitterid under @ twitterid have no direction re # brexit is deeply disturbing
bespoke is just a fancy word for , shit
why do n't simply ask nigel farage , an mep since 1999 & intimate knowledge of the wrongs & corruption of the eu , to share his plan ?
he must have one .
what 's that you say ?
he does n't have a plan ?
he rarely visits brussels & strasbourg ?
but he caused this mess !
they still do n't know how they 're going to sort out the ni border .
mogg regards that as 'someone else 's problem ' they have no more idea what they want from brexit than the people they tricked into voting for it

bernard jenkin on @ twitterid said the same thing , like most brexiters he tried to separate the roi from the eu stating that if we do n't want a border & the roi do n't want a border it 's not our fault if the eu impose one , usual delusion .
his performance was the epitome of disingenuousness .
where are the details of this bespoke deal the eu are going to give to the eu ?
where is bbc news responsible journalis asking these testing question as the countries paid national broadcaster ?
really someone needs do something about the poor reporting ! !
you did see lk 's exchange with the pm last week i take it .
a journo ca n't make a politician talk , but by asking and repeating a sensible question with only evasion in response , the pm looked seriously wanting .
i was being subtle .
she was like a rabbit caught in headlights , making the same sound over & over again .

documents.title: time running out to apply for eu licence
text: time is running out for any british-based banks that want to apply to maintain their access to the eurozone after brexit .
`` any bank that wishes to relocate from the uk to the euro area should really have submitted its licence application already , '' said european central bank board member sabine lautenschlaeger .
`` but if it has n't , it should do so by the end of the second quarter of 2018 at the latest . ''
eight banks have already applied for a licence , and four others are planning to significantly extend their activities in the euro area .

documents.title: can the uk keep brexit hand close to chest ?
text: government ministers are gathering for two days of brexit meetings to sketch out what the uk 's future relationship with the eu will look like .
although businesses have repeated calls for clarity over its negotiating position , the government has so far refused to reveal its hand , saying that would weaken its position .
however , bbc political editor laura kuenssberg says :

`` what we 've seen on many occasions , frankly , is although the uk has tried to keep things very quiet , the other side , where you 've got dozens , literally , of people involved , as soon as something lands in brussels it end up coming out . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: asia markets run out of puff
text: after a strong start , it was a mixed finish for stocks in asia on wednesday .
japan 's nikkei 225 index pulled back from session highs to close up 0.2 % , or 35.13 points , at 21,645.37 .
australia 's s & p/asx 200 added 0.8 % , or 43.50 points , at 5,876.800 .
on the downside , south korea 's kospi index dropped 2.3 % , or 56.75 points , to end at 2,396.56 .
hong kong 's hang seng eased back 0.9 % , or 272.22 points , to close at 30,323.20 .

documents.title: how does the potential tesco back pay settlement add up ?
text: paula lee is one of the leigh day lawyers representing 100 people in an equal pay claim against tesco .
people can claim up to six years back pay , and the claim could take four years , making up 10 years back pay .
times that by thousands of workers , and that 's how the figure could get up to £ 4bn , she says .

documents.title: london slightly ahead
text: london shares are now slightly ahead .
the ftse 100 has risen 0.64 % or 45.4 points to 7,186.82 .

the index is led by scottish mortgage investment trust , up 3.8 % to 438.2p , and old mutual , whose shares have gained 2.5 % to 228.2p on news that the firm had the highest net inflows of any firm in the uk market in 2017 .
tesco 's shares have slipped 0.93 % to 198.05p over the supermarket chain facing britain 's largest ever equal pay claim , which could cost up to £ 4bn .
the ftse 250 is also treading water , up 0.55 % or 106.7 points to 19,369.30 .

documents.title: no swimsuits please
text: sarah harrison , chief executive of the gambling commission , is stepping down , and she had some harsh words for the industry .
she highlighted issues such as sexism , inequality , lack of support for problem gamblers , and poor customer service in a speech ahead of her departure .

she called out the world 's biggest gambling conference -ice totally gaming - which is being held in london over some of the women there being told to wear `` nothing more than swimsuits to attract customers '' .
`` if you look round the exhibition hall you 'll see men representing their businesses wearing smart suits and women being asked to wear not much more than swimsuits .
that 's totally unacceptable .
it 's not reflective of a modern economy . ''
she adds that businesses that have more diverse workforces are more likely to make better decisions .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: plane deal to tackle china 's pilot shortage
text: we 've not seen many deals announced here at the singapore airshow yet .
but here 's a small but interesting one .
piper is selling 152 of its small aircraft used to train pilots to a chinese flight school - it 's the us planemaker 's biggest ever order .
and while the numbers are n't huge - the deal is worth about $ 72m ( £ 51.6m ) - it 's interesting given the well-publicised pilot shortage in asia , and china in particular .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: snap fends off competition from facebook and instagram
text: snapchat 's owner snap surprised investors when it released better-than-expected quarterly numbers on tuesday - sending its us-listed shares up more than 20 % in after-hours trade .
analysts said the messaging app was gaining some steam as it continued to fend off competition from facebook and instagram .
revenue came in at $ 285.7m ( £ 204.77m ) in the quarter that ended on 31 december , up 72 % from a year earlier , the firm said .
snapchat 's daily active users rose to 187 million - up from 178 million in the third quarter .
the measure of daily active users is watched closely by analysts and investors as it is tied to potential revenue growth from advertising .
the turnaround came as a surprise for investors who were disappointed last year when the firm reported quarterly losses of more than $ 400m ( £ 337m ) .

documents.title: are consumers really being safeguarded ?
text: the cap on energy bills for the most vulnerable households has been raised because of rising costs .
before today the cap was set for five million households at £ 1,031 for their energy bills .
that has been raised to about £ 1,087 .
ofgem says that by extending the safeguarding tariff , an additional one million customers will be able to save £ 60 a year from what they would usually pay .
however , this is actually a drop in annual savings on average - from £ 115 down to £ 66 , when the tariff rises by 5.5 % in april due to higher energy costs .
`` what i can assure everybody is that the 5 million people doing this will be paying fair prices for their energy , '' dermot nolan , ofgem 's chief executive told bbc radio 5 live .
`` any price rises are regrettably but we 've gone over any price rises with the competition authorities to make sure they are fair and only reflects the most efficient cost .
`` prices can rise under caps , but they can also fall . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: businesses call for brexit certainty
text: the british chambers of commerce has written an open letter to theresa may saying that the government must set out its brexit plans and that the patience of business is `` wearing thin '' over lack of clarity .
they have asked for an answer within a fortnight .

business secretary greg clark says : `` of course business wants to have the greatest possible certainty about the arrangements that we will have for trade in the future , investment decisions are being made all the time . ''
however , he sticks to the government line that it does n't want to reveal its negotiating position .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: a moment of clarity ?
text: greg clark says there needs to be a `` much clearer definition of who is an employee , who is a contracted worker , and who is self-employed '' and that the government is `` drawing up those clearer definitions '' .

he says if people are self employed `` then the contractual terms that they operate under must no be so onerous that they should be abusive '' including that people who are sick should be able to `` take an appointment '' .
he says people will be `` very clear in a way that they 're not at the moment '' whether they are an employee , a subcontractor , or self employed .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'like up nickels in front of a steamroller '
text: further to wall street yesterday - it seems some traders bet on volatility itself .

the so-called `` fear index '' - the volatility index traded in the options market chicago - has grown rapidly in the last ten years , says chris ralph , chief investment officer at st james ' place .

some people had bet that sustained quantitative easing meant volatility would be low for some time to come , but on monday some of the products created to support this trade fell `` very substantially '' , he says , `` up to 90 % in one single day '' because volatility back up .
nomura and credit suisse were forced to close these products from a single day 's trading .

`` in a world where it 's very difficult to get returns on cash , some investors are taking quite a lot of risk - it 's a bit like up nickels in front of a steamroller - [ an ] accident waiting to happen , because they really want to capitalise on any opportunity to make decent returns . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: gig workers to get holiday and sick pay ?
text: millions of people in the gig economy of flexible and part-time workers are going to have rights including holiday and sick pay backed up by the government , business secretary greg clark says .

`` we 're enforcing the rights that people have , so employees and contract workers are entitled to sick pay , but often the little guy does n't have the ability to enforce the payments of those rights against an employer that wants to deny them , so we will make sure that they are enforced , '' he told bbc radio 4 's today programme .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: rio tinto 's annual profit soars
text: global mining firm rio tinto has posted a massive jump in annual profit thanks to rising commodity prices .
underlying earnings for 2017 hit $ 8.6bn ( £ 6.2bn ) , up from $ 5.1bn a year earlier and broadly in line with analyst expectations .
strong demand for materials including iron ore and coal boosted profits at the british-australian giant .
it had more good news for shareholders , announcing a record full-year dividend of $ 2.90 per share , and a $ 1bn share buyback .

documents.title: ofgem introduces 'safeguard tariff '
text: ofgem has announced a new safeguard tariff for vulnerable customers - a price cap .
it 's the first time a million customers on warm home discount are included in such a cap .
`` these customers will initially make annualised savings of around £ 115 on average because suppliers have to cut their prices to below the level of the safeguard tariff cap , '' ofgem said .
`` these savings will fall to around £ 66 a year from april when the level of the safeguard tariff rises due to higher energy costs . ''

documents.title: musk rocket launch generated 'unprecedented excitement '
text: back to elon musk 's test flight of the falcon heavy - the world 's most powerful rocket .
it seems that there is an increased interest in space from the public , a phenomenon similar to the excitement at a rock concert .

`` i 've been covering nasa for several decades and i 've seen exciting things , but i 'm really astonished by just how many people showed up at a space launch that is n't done by nasa , '' keith cowing , nasawatch.com editor told radio 5 live breakfast .
`` there were over 600,000 people waiting for the youtube live stream broadcast to begin - i 've never seen that before . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: employer 'knew ' dpd driver was ill
text: more on flexi workers ' rights - it recently came to light that a dpd delivery driver died months after his firm fined him £ 150 for attending a hospital appointment .
don lane , 53 , who had diabetes , died on 4 january after collapsing in december .
dpd said that it did not know that mr lane 's health had declined and that the fine had been issued in error .

his widow ruth lane told bbc 5 live breakfast that it was not possible that dpd and mr lane 's colleagues did not know that he was sick , and that when he fought for the money , the company refused to rescind the fine .
`` it was n't an error , they made an actual final judgement , '' she said .
`` all his work colleagues [ knew he was ill ] .
i had to go and him up from work after he had a funny turn - they knew . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: 'lured into a false sense of security '
text: shares in london yesterday had their biggest one-day fall since the brexit refeendum - around £ 50bn was wiped of the value of the ftse 100 , which was down 2.6 % .
over on wall street , where the turbulence originated at the end of last week , the dow jones industrial average fell by more then 2 % when it opened , but finished the session up 2.3 % .
sonja laud , head of equity at fidelity international , says the context of the market swings is that in 2017 there were `` very good returns but little , if any , volatility . ''

`` so what 's happening now is probably much more normal in a longer term context than 2017 has been , and it was always clear that any correction would feel a lot more painful if it happened today , given that we have been lured int [ to ] this false sense of security because we have n't had a correction for so long . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: tesco facing largest ever equal pay claim
text: tesco is facing britain 's largest ever equal pay claim and a possible bill running to £ 4bn .
thousands of women who work in tesco stores could receive back pay totalling £ 20,000 if the legal challenge demanding parity with men who work in the company 's warehouses is successful .
a similar claim has been ongoing with the walmart-owned asda supermarket chain since 2008 .
in august 2017 , an employment appeal ruled that shop floor staff do jobs comparable to mostly male warehouse workers .

`` the basic flow chart for an equal pay claim is that first the woman has to show that she has the right comparable , if she succeeds in doing that she has to show that work of equal value is going on , '' paula lee , employment solicitor at leigh day solicitors told wake up to money .

`` work of equal value has been enshrined in our legislation since 1984 this has n't been hiding anywhere , and to say that we need to prop up the biggest employer in the country on unfair wages is an unpleasant argument . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: 'crazy ' us market swings
text: tuesday was an interesting day for the dow jones industrial average , which saw us stocks dipping and rising all over the map .
at one point the index was down by 567 points , and at its height , it rose by 600.48 points , eventually closing 2.3 % higher at 567.02 points .

the markets entered a concussion protocol after taking a violent hit over the last few years , '' walter todd , chief investment officer and managing director at investment strategy firm greenwood capital on south carolina told wake up to money .
investors got spoiled over the last 18 months without even a 3 % pull-back .
in a normal year it would be 4-5 % .
memories are a bit short and folks have forgotten what it feels like to have a correction . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: asian markets wobble in afternoon trade
text: after spending much of the day in positive territory on wednesday , markets in asia started to fall back in afternoon trade .
japan 's nikkei 225 index was up just 0.6 % after being up more than 3 % earlier .
the mixed day followed choppy trading in the us on tuesday which ended with the dow jones industrial average rising 2.3 % , and a global sell-off that began last week .
elsewhere , hong kong 's hang seng was flat , up 0.2 % , having climbed almost 3 % earlier .
australia 's s & p/asx 200 rose 1.3 % in morning trade , but closed up just 0.75 % to 5,876.8 points .
south korea kospi index was down 1.1 % in afternoon trade .

documents.title: elon musk 's falcon heavy rocket launches successfully
text: us entrepreneur elon musk has launched his new rocket , the falcon heavy , from the kennedy space center in florida .
the mammoth vehicle - the most powerful since the shuttle system - lifted clear of its pad without incident to soar high over the atlantic ocean .
it was billed as a risky test flight in advance of the lift-off .
`` i had this image of just a giant explosion on the pad , a wheel bouncing down the road .
but fortunately that 's not what happened , '' he told reporters after the event .

documents.title: is the good work plan enough ?
text: the uk government is to give gig economy workers new rights including holiday and sick pay for the first time .

however the trade union congress ( tuc ) does n't feel that the good work plan set out by the government as a result of the taylor review are enough , as the plan will still leave 1.8 million workers without key rights .

`` our real concern is that the government is taking a small step , but it will not redress the balance of power at work or give people more security at work , '' hannah reed , the tuc 's senior employment rights officer told bbc 5 live 's wake up to money programme .

`` all workers deserve to receive a written statement on the first day of their job telling them how much their pay is , and people deserve to have a right to a payslip telling them how much they will be paid at the end of the week and how much the company will deduct . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live
